name: Assessment of Discharge Process from the Pediatric Cardiology Unit
description: Using a survey research design with a convenience sample, the investigators will evaluate discharge teaching in the Pediatric Cardiology Unit at the Stollery Children's Hospital. The survey tool will provide anonymous data from parents related to their children's hospitalization and discharge from hospital.

citation.text: Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C., & Mackie, A. S. (2014). Assessment of the discharge process in a tertiary-care pediatric cardiology unit. Canadian Journal of Cardiology, 30(10, Supplement), S187-S188.

Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C., & Mackie, A. S. (2014). Assessment of the discharge process in a tertiary-care pediatric cardiology unit. Canadian Journal of Cardiology, 30(10, Supplement), S187-S188.

Schuh, M., Schendel, S., Islam, S., Klassen, K., Morrison, L., Rankin, K. N., Robert, C. and Mackie, A. S. (2016), Parent readiness for discharge from a tertiary care pediatric cardiology unit. J Spec Pediatr Nurs, 21: 139–146.
